responses: Maybe you should cook pasta or pizza.

patterns: You have a favourite car?

Maybe a new car is a good idea.
responses: I think Range Rover have some beutiful and smart cars.
In my opinion Range Rover have very interestings car.

patterns: What is an AI?
What do you know about AI?
How about AI?
responses: AI, or Artificial Intelligence, is about high-performing computers.
Artificial intelligence (AI) is a wide-ranging branch of computer science concerned with building smart machines capable of performing tasks.

patterns: I want to lose some weight. What do you recomend?
I think I will start to run 30 minute every day.
Maybe I will make a salad for lunch.
responses: I think a healty life-style is something that everyone should take it serios.
I think a healty life-style is always a good idea.

patterns: I think I want to buy some flowers for my room. Any sugestion?
I will go to make a bouquet of flowers for my mom.
What do you think about flowers?
I want to buy some flowers.
responses: I love flowers. I think a bouquet is always a great present.
Every time I see flowers it make me so happy.

patterns: I need some help.
You can help me?
Help me please!
responses: What can I do for you?
Sure, what you need?
What information you wanna know?

patterns: Can AI make mistakes?
What happened if an AI make a mistake?
Is posible for AI to make mistakes?
responses: AI, or Artificial Intelligence, is about high-performing computers. They are very smart, but they do make mistakes. Big mistakes.
The errors that AI systems make are a direct result of the intelligence that those machines are required to exhibit.

patterns: How is weather today?
How is gonna be outside today?
You know something about weather?
responses: Outside will be sunny and hot. Sunglasses will be perfect today.
Outside will be rainy. Better you take your umbrella.

patterns: You know something about animals?
I need some informations about animals.
What do you know about animals?
responses: Ask me about lions, bears, wolves and penguins.
I know some informations about lions, bears, wolves and penguins.

patterns: Ok, then I want some informations about lions.
What do you know about lions?
You know something interesting about lions?
responses: Lions are the only cats that live in groups and a group, or pride, can be up to 30 lions, depending on how much food and water is available.
A lion's roar can be heard up to eight kilometres away and lions scent mark their territory, using their wee, to create a border.

patterns: Ok, then I want some informations about bears.
What do you know about bears?
You know something interesting about bears?
responses: Bears are extraordinarily intelligent animals. Bears grieve deeply for others.
Bears have excellent senses of smell, sight and hearing.
Bears care deeply about family members.

patterns: Ok, then I want some informations about wolves.
What do you know about wolves?
You know something interesting about wolves?
responses: They have four toes with claws in an oval shape.
Wolves mate for life and a litter of wolves is usually 4 to 6 pups.
A pack of wolves can range from 2 to over 30 wolves and wolves can run at 36 to 38 MPH.

patterns: Ok, then I want some informations about penguins.
What do you know about penguins?
You know something interesting about penguins?
responses: A group of penguins in the water is called a raft but on land they're called a waddle!
The black and white tuxedo look donned by most penguin species is a clever camouflage called countershading.
Penguins may huddle together for several reasons and penguins evolved to fly underwater.

patterns: Ok, then I want some informations about music.
What do you know about music?
You know something interesting about music?
responses: In 2016, Mozart Sold More CDs than Beyonce.
Some People Feel Nothing Toward Music.
Listening to Music Enhances Physical Performance.

patterns: Tell me a joke!
Tell me something funny!
Do you know a joke?
responses: What do you call a boomerang that won’t come back?A stick.
What time is it when the clock strikes 13?Time to get a new clock.
Why did the dinosaur cross the road?Because the chicken wasn’t born yet.
